name: MakeNSIS
help: NSIS creates installers that are capable of installing, uninstalling, setting system settings, extracting files, etc. Because it's based on script files you can fully control every part of your installer.

properties.name: Verbosity
properties.help: 0=no output, 1=errors only, 2=warnings and errors, 3=info, warnings, and errors, 4=all output

properties.name: CompilerPriority
properties.help: set the priority of the compiler process accordingly. 0=idle, 1=below normal, 2=normal (default), 3=above normal, 4=high, 5=realtime.

properties.name: LogOutputFile
properties.help: Tells the compiler to print its log to that file (instead of the screen)

properties.name: NoConfig
properties.help: disables inclusion of nsisconf.nsh. Without this parameter, installer defaults are set from nsisconf.nsh.

properties.name: NoCurrentDirectoryChange
properties.help: disables the current directory change to that of the .nsi file.

properties.name: InputCharset
properties.help: allows you to specify a specific codepage for files without a BOM. (ACP|OEM|CP#|UTF8|UTF16<LE|BE>)

properties.name: OutputCharset
properties.help: allows you to specify the codepage used by stdout when the output is redirected. (ACP|OEM|CP#|UTF8[SIG]|UTF16<LE|BE>[BOM])

properties.name: OnlyRunPreprocessor
properties.help: will only run the preprocessor and print the result to stdout.

properties.name: OnlyRunSaveVersionPreprocessor
properties.help: will only run the preprocessor and print the result to stdout. The safe version will not execute instructions like !appendfile or !system. !packhdr and !finalize are never executed.

properties.name: DefinedSymbols
properties.help: One or more times will add to symbols to the globally defined list (See !define).

properties.name: ExecutionCodes
properties.help: One or more times will execute the code you specify following it.
